ygData.subject: Re: Some thoughts
ygData.msgSnippet: A cam?! That is insane! This is just a fishing pole! It is not going to cost that much! Even if they never break no one would pay the 30 plat for the fishing
ygData.messageBody:
A cam?! That is insane! This is just a fishing pole! It is not going to cost
that much! Even if they never break no one would pay the 30 plat for the
fishing pole that we'd have to sell it for to make a profit. Anything
combination over 5 plat is an idiotic price to spend making a fishing pole.
And if it really does cost more than 5 plat to make, then it's not worth it
in the slightest amount! I already doubt that people are going to pay the
price we ask for the next to worthless toy that we call a spyglass! Any high
priced components, such as gears now need to be left out, they aren't, or
better not be part of the fishing pole.

>also a cam might be used for the reel of the fishing pole
>----- Original Message -----
>From: <lukas@...>
>To: <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
>Sent: Friday, August 20, 1999 6:36 PM
>Subject: [EQ_Tinkering] Some thoughts
>
>
> > From: lukas@...
> >
> >
> > Last night's attempts resulted in no luck again. I think we're right
>with
> > the metal shaft and rod combos but we're missing something. Here's a
>few
> > of my thoughts thus far:
> >
> > - Fletching strings or dwarven wire as a component seems unlikely.
> > Although some items need things MADE by other trade skills (compass), I
> > can't think of anything that requires you buy components from a
>different
> > trade skill. Dwarven wire is for the Trueshot Bow quest (?) and takes a
> > while to obtain - lots of travelling.
> >
> > - Spiderling silk sounds like a good possibility. Watch out though,
>there
> > is SPIDER silk, and SPIDERLING silk. The latter seems more likely as
> > spiderlings are right in Steamfont and it would be very similar to how
>the
> > lockpicks need a rat ear.
> >
> > - Spriket? Assuming that the two books are all that exists of tinkering
> > now, a spriket is the only item not used for any project. What is a
> > spriket though? Not in the dictionary...
> >
> > - Raw bamboo doesn't seem like a likely component. It is a bard
> > instrument, also the pic of the collapsible pole shows it constructed of
> > metal.
> >
> > - A bottle as a possible component.
> >
> >
> > Luke
